column4: Weak PC sales  strong dollar hurt Nvidia's second-quarter forecast
column5: Nvidia Corp forecast lower-than-expected revenue for the second quarter  weighed down by lower demand for its graphic processor units due to a fall in personal computer sales and a strong dollar.

column4: UPDATE 2-Weak PC sales  strong dollar hurt Nvidia's 2nd-qtr forecast
column5: * Shares fall as much as 4.4 pct after market   (Adds analyst  CFO comments)

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Nvidia's revenue forecast misses estimates due to lower PC sales
column5: May 7 Nvidia Corp forecast lower-than-expected revenue for the second quarter  weighed down by lower demand for its graphic processor units due to a fall in personal computer sales and a stronger dollar.
May 7 Nvidia Corp posted a 4.4 percent rise in quarterly revenue  as the graphics-chip maker moves beyond supplying chips for personal computers to focus on processors for cars and cloud computing.

column4: EU antitrust regulators not probing Qualcomm licensing deals -EU source
column5: BRUSSELS European Union antitrust regulators are not investigating U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm's patent licensing deals  an EU source said on Thursday in response to media reports saying that scrutiny of the company had been expanded to this issue.

column4: UPDATE 1-EU antitrust regulators not probing Qualcomm licensing deals -EU source
column5: BRUSSELS  May 7 European Union antitrust regulators are not investigating U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm's  patent licensing deals  an EU source said on Thursday in response to media reports saying that scrutiny of the company had been expanded to this issue.

column4: EU antitrust regulators not probing Qualcomm licensing deals - EU source
column5: BRUSSELS  May 7 European Union antitrust regulators are not investigating U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm  on its patent licensing deals  an EU source said on Thursday  refuting media reports saying the issue was on the European Commission's radar.
